page.title: 03St. LEODEGAR'S CHURCH
page.content: It was rebuilt with stronger foundations in 1420 by a mason named {Roger Denys,}from London.But he had to use the fallen stone.This is why there are columned pillars on the north side, (from the old church) andoctagonal pillars on the opposite side. The Oak roof originally had 10 carved angels but only 5 remain,3 on the south side and 2 on the north.A new tower was built on the west end so there was less risk of it falling on the church. In 1760 the chancel was demolished. the rector,{Dr John Shaw,}was having his rectory(now Wyberton park)improved.So he had the builders to build a new chancel out of brick instead of stone.
